com.github.dm.jrt.stream

Class JRoutineStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.stream.JRoutineStream

  • public class JRoutineStream
extends Object
    Utility class acting as a factory of stream routine builders.

    A stream routine builder allows to easily build a concatenation of invocations as a single routine.

    For instance, a routine computing the root mean square of a number of integers can be defined as: 

    
 final Routine<Integer, Double> rms = JRoutineStream.<Integer>withStream()
                                                          .map(i -> i * i)
                                                          .map(averageFloat())
                                                          .map(Math::sqrt)
                                                          .buildRoutine();

    Created by davide-maestroni on 07/01/2016.

      • withStreamAccept

        @NotNull
public static <IN> StreamBuilder<IN,IN> withStreamAccept(@NotNull
                                                                  Consumer<Channel<IN,?>> consumer)
        Returns a stream routine builder producing only the inputs passed by the specified consumer.
        The data will be produced only when the invocation completes.
        If any other input is passed to the built routine, the invocation will be aborted with an IllegalStateException.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the consumer instance.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

      • withStreamAccept

        @NotNull
public static <IN> StreamBuilder<IN,IN> withStreamAccept(int count,
                                                                  @NotNull
                                                                  Consumer<Channel<IN,?>> consumer)
        Returns a stream routine builder producing only the inputs passed by the specified consumer.
        The data will be produced by calling the consumer count number of times only when the invocation completes.
        If any other input is passed to the built routine, the invocation will be aborted with an IllegalStateException.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of times the consumer is called.
        consumer - the consumer instance.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified count number is 0 or negative.

      • withStreamOf

        @NotNull
public static <IN> StreamBuilder<IN,IN> withStreamOf(@Nullable
                                                              Channel<?,? extends IN> channel)
        Returns a stream routine builder producing only the inputs returned by the specified channel.
        The data will be produced only when the invocation completes.
        If any other input is passed to the built routine, the invocation will be aborted with an IllegalStateException.

        Note that the passed channel will be bound as a result of the call, so, in order to support multiple invocations, consider wrapping the channel in a replayable one, by calling the Channels.replay(Channel) utility method.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the input channel.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
